holidays.name: Independence Day (USA)
holidays.description: Celebrate the United States' declaration of independence from British rule in 1776 with fireworks, parades, and barbecues!
holidays.origin: Commemorates the adoption of the Declaration of Independence on July 4, 1776.
holidays.funFact: The Liberty Bell in Philadelphia is traditionally rung only on special occasions, including the 200th Independence Day anniversary in 1976.

holidays.name: World UFO Day
holidays.description: An eccentric celebration of unidentified flying objects and alien life, encouraging people to gaze at the skies and ponder extraterrestrial mysteries.
holidays.origin: Established in 2001 to raise awareness about UFOs and to encourage governments to disclose hidden information.
holidays.funFact: July 4 was chosen because it marks the date of the alleged Roswell UFO incident crash in 1947.

holidays.name: Barbecue Day
holidays.description: A tasty tribute to outdoor grilling and smoky, flame-cooked delightsâ€”perfect timing to fire up the grill and savor the smoky goodness!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday celebrated mainly in the U.S., timed with summer and Independence Day festivities.
holidays.funFact: The first American-style barbecue competitions began popping up in the 1950s in the southern United States.

holidays.name: Compliment Your Mirror Day
holidays.description: A quirky self-love day that urges you to look in the mirror and give yourself some well-deserved praise.
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday created to encourage positive self-reflection and boost self-esteem.
holidays.funFact: Studies have shown that giving yourself positive affirmations in the mirror can improve mood and confidence.
